protocol_name: RNA extraction of brain stem tissue for post-mortem diagnosis of rabies in animals by the LN34 real-time RT-PCR assay
protocol_name_html: RNA extraction of brain stem tissue for post-mortem diagnosis of rabies in animals by the LN34 real-time RT-PCR assay
description:
Purpose

 

To describe the procedure of RNA extraction on post mortem brain tissue specimen using the Direct-zol™ RNA MiniPrep kit (Zymo). The extracted RNA is used in the diagnosis of lyssavirus infection by the LN34 pan-lyssavirus real-time RT-PCR assay.
before_start:
Definitions and Keywords

 

BSC – Biological Safety Cabinet

PPE – Personal Protective Equipment

RT-PCR – Reverse Transcription-Polymerase Chain Reaction

RNA – Ribonucleic Acid

RNase – Ribonuclease

Room Temperature – Temperature range of 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F)

 

Equipment, Materials and Reagents

 

  1. Supplies
    1. Accessioning labels
    2. Disposable gloves
    3. Sterile polypropylene micro-centrifuge tubes (1.5 and 2 ml, RNase/DNase free)
    4. Aerosol (filter) barrier tips (RNase/DNase free)
    5. Rack for Microcentrifuge tubes
    6. Ice
    7. MagNA Lyser green beads (Roche) (optional)
  2. Equipment and Instruments
    1. BSC (Class II)
    2. Pipettes
    3. Vortex
    4. Microcentrifuge
    5. Freezer
    6. Mini beadbeater (optional)
  3. Reagents
    1. Direct-zol™ RNA MiniPrep kit (Zymo Research)
    2. Ethanol (95% – 100%, molecular grade recommended)
  4. Acceptable surface decontaminants
    1. RNase Away® (Fisher Scientific)
    2. 70% Ethanol
  5. Reagent Preparation
    • Add ethanol (95-100%) to Direct-zol RNA PreWash concentrate and RNA Wash Buffer concentrate as advised by the manufacturer.

 

Quality Control and Corrective Action

 

  • All issues, comments, concerns, or deviations from the protocol are to be documented and brought to the attention of the lab supervisor or technical supervisor immediately if they are thought to affect the quality of the end product in any aspect.
  • Temperature levels are to be monitored on applicable equipment to ensure incubators, refrigerators, and freezers stay within criteria set for acceptable temperature range.
  • Specimen for RNA extraction will be assigned based on the test ordered and/or the recommendations of the technical supervisor or lab supervisor.
  • All samples are to have unique identifiers and corresponding accession labels provided in advance of starting the RNA extraction procedure.
warning:
Hazards and Safety Precautions

 

  • Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (gloves, safety glasses, and lab coat).
  • Follow procedures as demonstrated in the Biosafety in Microbiological and Biomedical Laboratories (BMBL), 5th Edition: (https://www.cdc.gov/biosafety/publications/bmbl5/bmbl.pdf)
  • Samples may contain infectious agent(s). You should be aware of the health hazard presented by such agents and should use, store, and dispose of such samples in accordance with the required safety regulations.
  • Pre-exposure rabies vaccination, regular serologic tests, and booster immunizations as necessary are required for all persons prior to working with lyssaviruses or with known or potentially infected specimen, or engaging in diagnostic, production, or research activities with these viruses (CDC, MMWR, 48: 1-22, 1999, WHO, OIE).
  • Some chemicals used with this assay may be hazardous or become hazardous; refer to the SDS as needed. Dispose of chemical waste as directed in the SDS and according to local regulations.
  • TRIzol reagent is a hazardous chemical; contact with acids or bleach liberates toxic gases; ensure adequate ventilation; please refer to the safety data sheet for more information.

guidelines:
Purpose

 

To describe the procedure of RNA extraction on post mortem brain tissue specimen using the Direct-zol™ RNA MiniPrep kit (Zymo). The extracted RNA is used in the diagnosis of lyssavirus infection by the LN34 pan-lyssavirus real-time RT-PCR assay.

 

Responsibility

 

Technician will perform the procedure according to the protocol. Once the RNA extraction procedure is complete, the technician is to clean the work area, discard any biohazardous waste, and return the samples to storage.

 

Specimens

 

Homogenized brain tissue representing a full cross section of brain stem in TRIzol reagent

components.data: Set up your work space under the BSC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Set up your work space under the BSC

components.data:
• Frozen samples should be thawed just prior to testing.
  • Clean the BSC work surface using RNase Away® and 70% ethanol prior to starting work.
  • Layout plastic-lined absorbent work pad(s) in the hood to perform your work on.
  • Place reagents, supplies, and sample in the BSC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Frozen samples should be thawed just prior to testing.
  • Clean the BSC work surface using RNase Away® and 70% ethanol prior to starting work.
  • Layout plastic-lined absorbent work pad(s) in the hood to perform your work on.
  • Place reagents, supplies, and sample in the BSC.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Thoroughly homogenize brain pieces using a bead beater, micro tissue grinder or sterile applicator stick.

 

IMPORTANT: Ensure tissue is thoroughly homogenized. Incomplete homogenization will decrease RNA yield.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Thoroughly homogenize brain pieces using a bead beater, micro tissue grinder or sterile applicator stick.

 

IMPORTANT: Ensure tissue is thoroughly homogenized. Incomplete homogenization will decrease RNA yield.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Let sit for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let sit for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge sample at 10,000–16,000 × g for 2 minutes
components.name: Description

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Transfer 300 μl of the supernatant into a new sterile microcentrifuge tube. Store the remaining homogenate in a screw-top tube at -20oC. The supernatant should be clear, pink liquid similar to TRIzol reagent. Avoid collection of lipids and solid tissue.

 

NOTE: For very little tissue (such as from a small bat), deteriorated tissue, or non-brain tissue, use 600 μl of the supernatant for extraction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer 300 μl of the supernatant into a new sterile microcentrifuge tube. Store the remaining homogenate in a screw-top tube at -20oC. The supernatant should be clear, pink liquid similar to TRIzol reagent. Avoid collection of lipids and solid tissue.

 

NOTE: For very little tissue (such as from a small bat), deteriorated tissue, or non-brain tissue, use 600 μl of the supernatant for extraction.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: All centrifugation steps should be performed at 10,000 – 16,000 × g
components.name: Description

source_data.description: All centrifugation steps should be performed at 10,000 – 16,000 × g

components.data: Add equal volume ethanol (95–100%) to the homogenate supernatant (e.g. 300 μl ethanol to 300 μl TRIzol-supernatant) and mix thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add equal volume ethanol (95–100%) to the homogenate supernatant (e.g. 300 μl ethanol to 300 μl TRIzol-supernatant) and mix thoroughly.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Transfer 600 µL of the ethanol-supernatant mixture to a Zymo-Spin™ IIC Column in a collection tube and centrifuge until the liquid has passed through the column (1 minute).

Discard the flow-through.

Repeat if there is more than 600 µL of ethanol-Trizol mixture for a sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer 600 µL of the ethanol-supernatant mixture to a Zymo-Spin™ IIC Column in a collection tube and centrifuge until the liquid has passed through the column (1 minute).

Discard the flow-through.

Repeat if there is more than 600 µL of ethanol-Trizol mixture for a sample.

components.data: Transfer column to a new collection tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer column to a new collection tube.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 400 μl Direct-zol RNA PreWash to the column and centrifuge for 30 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 400 μl Direct-zol RNA PreWash to the column and centrifuge for 30 seconds.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard the flow-through, return the column to the collection tube, and repeat the 400 µL Direct-zol PreWash step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow-through, return the column to the collection tube, and repeat the 400 µL Direct-zol PreWash step.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard the flow-through and return the column to the collection tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow-through and return the column to the collection tube.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 700 μl RNA Wash Buffer to the column and centrifuge for 2 minutes. Ensure that the wash buffer has been completely removed. Discard the flow-through and the collection tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 700 μl RNA Wash Buffer to the column and centrifuge for 2 minutes. Ensure that the wash buffer has been completely removed. Discard the flow-through and the collection tube.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer the column carefully into an RNase-free tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the column carefully into an RNase-free tube.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: To elute RNA, add 50 μl of DNase/RNase-Free water directly to the column matrix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To elute RNA, add 50 μl of DNase/RNase-Free water directly to the column matrix.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate for 30 seconds at room temperature then centrifuge for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for 30 seconds at room temperature then centrifuge for 1 minute.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: RNA is now ready for immediate use or storage. Keep extracted RNA on ice while in use. Carefully transfer RNA to new screw top flat bottom accession labeled microcentrifuge tube for long term storage at -70°C or colder.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: RNA is now ready for immediate use or storage. Keep extracted RNA on ice while in use. Carefully transfer RNA to new screw top flat bottom accession labeled microcentrifuge tube for long term storage at -70°C or colder.

components.data: RNA Purification
components.name: Section

components.data: Storage
components.name: Section

components.data:
• Preferably, the RNA sample should be used directly after extraction. The sample may be placed in the refrigerator for short term storage.
  • If a sample will not be used for a few days, it should be stored under long term storage conditions at -70°C or colder.
  • Storage at warmer temperatures or repeated freeze-thaws can lead to RNA degradation and affect diagnostic results.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Preferably, the RNA sample should be used directly after extraction. The sample may be placed in the refrigerator for short term storage.
  • If a sample will not be used for a few days, it should be stored under long term storage conditions at -70°C or colder.
  • Storage at warmer temperatures or repeated freeze-thaws can lead to RNA degradation and affect diagnostic results.
